title: create_return_label_request_body
description: A create return label request body

allOf.title: label_charge_event
allOf.description: Determines when the user's account will be charged for the label.

allOf.title: label_layout
allOf.description: The available layouts (sizes) in which shipping labels can be downloaded.  The label format determines which sizes are supported.  `4x6` is supported for all label formats, whereas `letter` (8.5" x 11") is only supported for `pdf` format.

label_layout.description: The layout (size) that you want the label to be in.  The `label_format` determines which sizes are allowed.  `4x6` is supported for all label formats, whereas `letter` (8.5" x 11") is only supported for `pdf` format.

allOf.title: label_format
allOf.description:
The possible file formats in which shipping labels can be downloaded. We recommend `pdf` format because it is supported by all carriers, whereas some carriers do not support the `png` or `zpl` formats. |Label Format | Supported Carriers |--------------|----------------------------------- |`pdf` | All carriers |`png` | `fedex`
`stamps_com`
`ups`
`usps` |`zpl` | `access_worldwide`
`apc`
`asendia`
`dhl_global_mail`
`dhl_express`
`dhl_express_australia`
`dhl_express_canada`
`dhl_express_worldwide`
`dhl_express_uk`
`dpd`
`endicia`
`fedex`
`fedex_uk`
`firstmile`
`globegistics`
`imex`
`newgistics`
`ontrac`
`rr_donnelley`
`stamps_com`
`ups`
`usps`

label_format.description: The file format that you want the label to be in.  We recommend `pdf` format because it is supported by all carriers, whereas some carriers do not support the `png` or `zpl` formats.

allOf.title: label_download_type
allOf.description:
There are two different ways to [download a label](https://www.shipengine.com/docs/labels/downloading/): |Label Download Type | Description |--------------------|------------------------------ |`url` |You will receive a URL, which you can use to download the label in a separate request. The URL will remain valid for 90 days.

This is the default if `label_download_type` is unspecified. |`inline` |You will receive the Base64-encoded label as part of the response. No need for a second request to download the label.

allOf.title: image_id
allOf.description: Used to identify an image resource.

label_image_id.description: The label image resource that was used to create a custom label image.
